alert.note: Alert for Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 8:55AM CST until January 13 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Cumberland River At Dover affecting Stewart County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cumberland River At Dover. * WHEN...From this morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 62.0 feet, Low lying agricultural areas along the river, adjacent tributaries, and river access points are inundated, including River Rd between Tom Earhart Rd and the Blue Creek Recreation Area boat ramp, Bellwood Branch Rd near Patricia Cir, Cub Creek Cove and the Commissay Hollow Accesss point, wildcat Creek Rd at Wildcat Creek, and Lee Hollow Rd at Dunaway Hollow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Monday the stage was 62.2 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 62.7 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 62.0 feet. - Flood stage is 66.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
